reviewText: Mrs. Brown's boys is totally hilarious and definitely not for children. This is a Region 2 DVD and can NOT be played on most U.S.A. DVD players. If you don't know if you have a REGION FREE DVD player, then don't order because it will NOT play.
summary: Greatly Funny! MAKE SURE YOUR PLAYER WILL PLAY THIS DVD!!

reviewText: This really is a laugh a minute, pure class for anyone who loves good Irish humour. If you've seen the stage show in particular, you're bound to love this. Brendan O'Carroll has never been funnier, and the whole thing is more polished even than his old RTE show of some years back. Even if the sit-com format isn't your usual cup of tea, this is worth watching just for the unscripted occasions when the production doesn't go to plan, which are frequently just as funny as the main material! Highly recommended.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Someone sent me a youTube clip of 'Mrs. Brown's Boys,' and I was instantly hooked. Unfortunately, I had to wait quite a while before it was released on DVD, but I can honestly say, it was well worth the wait! Hilarious!It's an Irish comedy featuring the Browns, a very dysfunctional family, encountering a manifold variety of issues which Mrs. Brown wades into and tries to sort. The humour sometimes seems completely random, and the lead, Brendan O'Carrol, has a penchant for ad libbing gleeful interjections and strongly worded opinions. Add to that the occasional stage/camera mistakes, asides, and direct addresses to the audience (yes, it's filmed before a live audience), and the result is completely entertaining and uproarious.The language might be considered kid inappropriate for U.S. sensibilities and consumption, sexual situations, gay issues, but that doesn't diminish the show, in ANY respect, in my opinion. But, if you're quite humourless, be warned~!This is an excellent series, and I recommend it highly. I loved this programme! Hopefully, season 2 is in the works.The only downside? U.S. viewers may have to wait a bit before the series shows up for them -- if it does.

reviewText: The disclaimer says you must have a multi-regional dvd player, which is true, but the dvd plays on most every computer. It's the funniest show around for the money right now, however, because of some of the language it won't make it to prime-time American audiences. For belly-laughs and funny situations it can't be beat!

reviewText: I watch the show on YouTube for FREE.  I don't have to worry about whether or not if it works with my dvd/blu-ray player. The shows are hilarious, only wish shows in the U.S. would follow this same path. (Never will with uptight people)  Anyway, if you live in the US (NTSC format), go on YouTube and enjoy. If you don't have a smart tv or your cable/satellite provider doesn't have access to YouTube, game systems like XBox360 and PS3 have an app you can download and install onto your system, and some blu-ray players also allow access to YouTube thus allowing you to view it on your television.
